abstract: Jamaican Prime Min Portia Simpson Miller raises topic of reparations for  slavery with British Prime Min David Cameron, who is related to 18th century owner of slaves in Jamaica; 14 Caribbean countries have been documenting damages they attribute to legacy of slavery with goal of demanding reparations and apologies from former European colonial powers that benefited from slave trade.
lead_paragraph: Jamaica’s prime minister, Portia Simpson Miller, raised the issue with Britain’s prime minister, Mr. Cameron, during a visit to the Caribbean island.

headline.main: David Cameron Grapples With Issue of Slavery Reparations in Jamaica
headline.print_headline: Legacy of Slavery Confronts British Premier in Jamaica

snippet: Jamaica’s prime minister, Portia Simpson Miller, raised the issue with Britain’s prime minister, Mr. Cameron, during a visit to the Caribbean island.
